guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
None of this surprises me in the least but gives me hope and a joyous reason to believe that our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ, will be returning a lot sooner than anyone may guess as this is all part of "The Grand Delusion" spoken of in 2 Thessalonians when Paul prophecies and says that God would "send a grand delusion to those who are perishing because they refused to believe the truth." 

It's also spoken of in the Book of Ezekiel, touched on by Jesus in The Book Of Matthew and, of course, spoken about in John's Book of The Revelation.

Let's never forget that Jesus forewarned us about this when he spoke of knowing the signs of the weather and that we should also fully know and be aware of the signs of His return.

body:
> None of this surprises me in the least but gives me hope and a joyous reason to believe that our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ, will be returning a lot sooner than anyone may guess

People have been saying that for 2000 years. I guess they want to be a part of something exciting and hope it all happens in their lifetime. But like a thief in the night *means* like a thief in the night. If you give it an honest look we're actually in an unusually peaceful period right now. I know it doesn't seem like it but compared to the rest of history so far I'd trade for this any day.

> as this is all part of "The Grand Delusion" spoken of in 2 Thessalonians when Paul prophecies and says that God would "send a grand delusion to those who are perishing because they refused to believe the truth."

Paul was not a prophet. The only prophets in that era were Jesus and John. Paul just made predictions based on his personal opinion, and his letters are so damaged by later editors that it's impossible to safely conclude what he thought even if he was perfect. And 2 Thessalonians is one of the entire letters that is thought to be a forgery. Which makes sense, because I really don't think Jesus ever gave the idea that God would be so unforgiving as to deceive people to keep them from being saved. And in general the real Paul was a faithful upholder of the gospel, as far as I can tell from the authentic parts of his letters.

body:
>we're actually in an unusually peaceful period right now 

You are joking, right? Calling what we go through now a peaceful time, is just plain wrong. There are many conflicts ongoing in the world. There has never been anything close to what BLM and Antifa are doing now. Whole western Europe is being destroyed. 

>People have been saying that for 2000 years. I guess they want to be a part of something exciting and hope it all happens in their lifetime. 

You are right. However, now we can clearly see how the stage is getting ready to bring us the sign of the beast from revelation. How I see it, there are two options. This whole covid operation will eventually come to an end and we'll wait for another time that will remind us again of what is written in Revelation. I honestly don't think this will happen, but it is possible. And the other possibility is that covid tyranny will spread even further, the pandemic will never end, and social credit system will be implemented all over world, together with digital ID's and neural implants. And I personally see this as really probable (With how they push the great reset, they don't plan us to return to our previous lives), and therefore I think that the 2nd coming is really close. From things I've read about I think that the seven years from Revelation will begin during next 10 years. 

>like a thief in the night means like a thief in the night. 

I don' believe that the 2nd coming of Jesus will be something that nobody is going to even think of happening. I think this is more about not knowing the exact date when He will come, but I'm sure that people who can see things in context will be able to guess the period of time, when it's going to happen. 

>that God would be so unforgiving as to deceive people to keep them from being saved.

I don't think you understand how that works. The delusion is aimed at people who refused to believe the truth. They are people who decided that they don't want to be saved by Jesus, so He lets them walk on that way. And it is important to point out, that God doesn't send delusion to anyone. He just wont stop the devil from overtaking these people completely.

parent.body:
> None of this surprises me in the least but gives me hope and a joyous reason to believe that our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ, will be returning a lot sooner than anyone may guess

People have been saying that for 2000 years. I guess they want to be a part of something exciting and hope it all happens in their lifetime. But like a thief in the night *means* like a thief in the night. If you give it an honest look we're actually in an unusually peaceful period right now. I know it doesn't seem like it but compared to the rest of history so far I'd trade for this any day.

> as this is all part of "The Grand Delusion" spoken of in 2 Thessalonians when Paul prophecies and says that God would "send a grand delusion to those who are perishing because they refused to believe the truth."

Paul was not a prophet. The only prophets in that era were Jesus and John. Paul just made predictions based on his personal opinion, and his letters are so damaged by later editors that it's impossible to safely conclude what he thought even if he was perfect. And 2 Thessalonians is one of the entire letters that is thought to be a forgery. Which makes sense, because I really don't think Jesus ever gave the idea that God would be so unforgiving as to deceive people to keep them from being saved. And in general the real Paul was a faithful upholder of the gospel, as far as I can tell from the authentic parts of his letters.

body:
> You are joking, right? Calling what we go through now a peaceful time, is just plain wrong. There are many conflicts ongoing in the world. There has never been anything close to what BLM and Antifa are doing now. Whole western Europe is being destroyed.

Yeah okay, countries constantly sacking each other for no reason and every one of them setting up a ruthless dictatorship is nowhere *close* to having a puny political riot every now and then.

> You are right. However, now we can clearly see how the stage is getting ready to bring us the sign of the beast from revelation.

You must not think I'm right, since you go on repeating the exact same thing as they did. The truth is, everything so far that could even possibly be linked to Revelation has been extremely minor, and not localized to our time. Plus, the beast is in all likelihood Nero, which is why he is identified by the cryptic number 666, because if they identified him directly there'd be hell to pay.

> the great reset

Why do you think Satan needs a great reset to conquer humanity? He had it in his grip from the beginning.

> and therefore I think that the 2nd coming is really close. From things I've read about I think that the seven years from Revelation will begin during next 10 years.

Doomsdayers say that every 10 years. Just like how every 12 years, the world will supposedly end in the next 12 years from global warming.

> I don' believe that the 2nd coming of Jesus will be something that nobody is going to even think of happening. I think this is more about not knowing the exact date when He will come, but I'm sure that people who can see things in context will be able to guess the period of time, when it's going to happen.

Now doesn't resemble the description of that time period. Well it does, but since most of the rest of history is so much worse in comparison it's far from being the biggest suspect.

> I don't think you understand how that works. The delusion is aimed at people who refused to believe the truth. They are people who decided that they don't want to be saved by Jesus, so He lets them walk on that way. And it is important to point out, that God doesn't send delusion to anyone. He just wont stop the devil from overtaking these people completely.

The text you cite explicitly describes God as being the one who sends the delusion. It was probably written by people who wanted to boast and feel superior like Pharisees.

body:
Because *Paul probably didn't write 2 Thessalonians*. It was written after his death by someone who ascribed supernatural attributes to him and the other apostles, and they can make him prophesy whatever they want.

But in fact, 2:2-12 is not even a prophecy, but merely a reminder of the fact that the end will involve the antichrist. Actually this passage, ironically, was written to address *doomsayers who were claiming that the end was here before the antichrist and other things had occurred*, thus you are actually condemning yourself by using it.

You are right. However, now we can clearly see how the stage is getting ready to bring us the sign of the beast from revelation. How I see it, there are two options. This whole covid operation will eventually come to an end and we'll wait for another time that will remind us again of what is written in Revelation. I honestly don't think this will happen, but it is possible. And the other possibility is that covid tyranny will spread even further, the pandemic will never end, and social credit system will be implemented all over world, together with digital ID's and neural implants. I don' believe that the 2nd coming of Jesus will be something that nobody is going to even think of happening. I think this is more about not knowing the exact date when He will come, but I'm sure that people who can see things in context will be able to guess the period of time, when it's going to happen.

They are people who decided that they don't want to be saved by Jesus, so He lets them walk on that way. And it is important to point out, that God doesn't send delusion to anyone. He just wont stop the devil from overtaking these people completely.

> You are joking, right? Calling what we go through now a peaceful time, is just plain wrong. There are many conflicts ongoing in the world. There has never been anything close to what BLM and Antifa are doing now. Whole western Europe is being destroyed.

Yeah okay, countries constantly sacking each other for no reason and every one of them setting up a ruthless dictatorship is nowhere *close* to having a puny political riot every now and then.

> You are right. However, now we can clearly see how the stage is getting ready to bring us the sign of the beast from revelation.

You must not think I'm right, since you go on repeating the exact same thing as they did. The truth is, everything so far that could even possibly be linked to Revelation has been extremely minor, and not localized to our time. Plus, the beast is in all likelihood Nero, which is why he is identified by the cryptic number 666, because if they identified him directly there'd be hell to pay.

> the great reset

Why do you think Satan needs a great reset to conquer humanity? He had it in his grip from the beginning.

> and therefore I think that the 2nd coming is really close. From things I've read about I think that the seven years from Revelation will begin during next 10 years.

Doomsdayers say that every 10 years. Just like how every 12 years, the world will supposedly end in the next 12 years from global warming.

> I don' believe that the 2nd coming of Jesus will be something that nobody is going to even think of happening. I think this is more about not knowing the exact date when He will come, but I'm sure that people who can see things in context will be able to guess the period of time, when it's going to happen.

Now doesn't resemble the description of that time period. Well it does, but since most of the rest of history is so much worse in comparison it's far from being the biggest suspect.

> I don't think you understand how that works. The delusion is aimed at people who refused to believe the truth. They are people who decided that they don't want to be saved by Jesus, so He lets them walk on that way. And it is important to point out, that God doesn't send delusion to anyone. You are joking, right? Calling what we go through now a peaceful time, is just plain wrong. There are many conflicts ongoing in the world. There has never been anything close to what BLM and Antifa are doing now. Whole western Europe is being destroyed.

Yeah okay, countries constantly sacking each other for no reason and every one of them setting up a ruthless dictatorship is nowhere close to having a puny political riot every now and then.

You are right. However, now we can clearly see how the stage is getting ready to bring us the sign of the beast from revelation.

You must not think I'm right, since you go on repeating the exact same thing as they did. The truth is, everything so far that could even possibly be linked to Revelation has been extremely minor, and not localized to our time. Plus, the beast is in all likelihood Nero, which is why he is identified by the cryptic number 666, because if they identified him directly there'd be hell to pay.

the great reset

Why do you think Satan needs a great reset to conquer humanity? He had it in his grip from the beginning.

and therefore I think that the 2nd coming is really close. From things I've read about I think that the seven years from Revelation will begin during next 10 years.

Doomsdayers say that every 10 years. Just like how every 12 years, the world will supposedly end in the next 12 years from global warming.

I don' believe that the 2nd coming of Jesus will be something that nobody is going to even think of happening. I think this is more about not knowing the exact date when He will come, but I'm sure that people who can see things in context will be able to guess the period of time, when it's going to happen.

Now doesn't resemble the description of that time period. Well it does, but since most of the rest of history is so much worse in comparison it's far from being the biggest suspect.

I don't think you understand how that works. The delusion is aimed at people who refused to believe the truth. They are people who decided that they don't want to be saved by Jesus, so He lets them walk on that way. And it is important to point out, that God doesn't send delusion to anyone. He just wont stop the devil from overtaking these people completely.

The text you cite explicitly describes God as being the one who sends the delusion. It was probably written by people who wanted to boast and feel superior like Pharisees.

Because *Paul probably didn't write 2 Thessalonians*. It was written after his death by someone who ascribed supernatural attributes to him and the other apostles, and they can make him prophesy whatever they want.

But in fact, 2:2-12 is not even a prophecy, but merely a reminder of the fact that the end will involve the antichrist. Actually this passage, ironically, was written to address *doomsayers who were claiming that the end was here before the antichrist and other things had occurred*, thus you are actually condemning yourself by using it.

> I'm saying that great reset is happening and together with covid passes, that are like the first step to social credit system, we are getting into the part of revelation where "without the mark of the beast you can't sell, you can't buy".

Correction: we're seeing something that is a *possible* candidate for that. Don't pretend nothing like this has ever been proposed or even happened before.

> In history there was not yet a thing that would match 'the mark' like this.

There's been a lot of things that were supposedly "the mark". Until I hear that it's 666 or 616 and is a sworn allegiance against God, it doesn't match and it's a conspiracy theory.

> I don't care that you don't believe what is written in revelation. Because where world is going, is clearly going to fulfill the Revelation prophecies.

People have never stopped saying that.

> So many things mentioned there didn't happened yet at all.

We don't even know if the book is authentic. It was very controversial for centuries and even the Orthodox church initially rejected it.

body: You are correct! For those who're merely posing at "being spiritual" (such as yourself) there is a great tendency to form those Scriptures to your own personal desires. Now, you obviously being one of those particularly unique perverts known as "furry", you would be in a particularly sinful state of existence and, as such - and being so driven by your own sexual desires and perversions - would seek to find all possible justification for what you do, even though God perceives such things as first level abominations, worthy only of his wrath. But, I'm not going to argue with you about that because the Day of Judgement will come and that's when you'll discover that everything you know is wrong and sinful and then you will experience "Wailing and gnashing of teeth." Never forget that ***everything you do will end up being between you and God and God always wins.***

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
The fact that you have to resort to personal attacks and made up ideas as opposed to actually countering me tells me I've won this argument. Have you read the gospels? Jesus never even mentions any of the things you accuse me of, but he does have quite a lot to say about those who pride themselves in supposedly being better in his sight than others, as you're doing right now, whether intentionally or more likely because you've been indoctrinated to think that way. If you are following "fundamentalist" or even mainstream so-called Christian media, stop believing them! They conveniently ignore 95% of Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John, the most important of everything! Labeling themselves "Christian" doesn't make them automatically trustworthy. They go the pagan way of trying to justify themselves by following rules and doing what they consider good works, even if they don't admit it, it shows in their attitude when they boast about themselves and condemn people they don't like. There was a group of people notorious for that in the new testament, and let's just say Jesus did not get along with them. And that is the behavior you seem to be mimicking, as I once did until this was revealed to me, and even still battle against.

Also I'm not a furry.
